  • â€œMeasuring task specific skills is not a good proxy for intelligence. Skill is heavily influenced by prior knowledge and experience... Intelligence lies in broader general purpose abilities. It is marked by skill acquisition and generalization rather than skill itselfã€‚â€ (ARC AGI Prize)

  • â€œAI doesn't need AGI to be transformative. Today's LLM models and infrastructure like Nvidia's Blackwell were already capable of disrupting trillions of dollars worth of knowledge work.â€
  • â€œHard to get real worked up over AGI timelines when less than 5% of work that could be improved by today's AI actually is.â€
  • â€œEven if there is a bubble, there's no way I'm stopping using chat GBT.â€

  • â€œThe key takeaway here is that itâ€™s essentially reducing the barrier for non-technical people to get started with building multi-agent workflows.â€

  • â€œWeâ€™re putting canvases on top of sort of the hardcore technical hood like the average person doesnâ€™t want to be chilling in a terminal.â€
  • â€œThereâ€™s so much emphasis on using LLM and agent workflows for engineering and coding that the knowledge workers the nontechnical people have been kind of left behind.â€
